title: Let Gangplanks Barrels Proc Lich Bane!

replies.body: I don't see why it should proc Trinity and not Lichbane, as their passives are both called spellblade. It's more about clarity than being able to play AP GP at that point (and I hardly think AP GP would be anything else than a fun build, come on)

it's actually surprisingly effective for splitpushing and teamfighting. Your oranges let you be a constant source of damage throughout the entire fight. The only thing that feels bad with it is that is barrels are almost completely useless with a lich bane build, as it only procs physical damage.

I think that The AOE Lich Bane proc might be TOO strong.
They likely made this not work for a reason.

Lich bane is Definitely the hardest hitting Spellblade if you get full AP

But does it hit harder than an AD Gangplank's crit barrel? Not really... 
Also, the barrels only shred armor, not MR, so you don't even get increased damage from that. So the Lich Bane proc wouldn't really be that strong(and if it is, AD GP is even stronger)
it's more for getting more silver serpents for your ult (your main dmg tool as ap gp) more easily.
Fair enough, I didn't really look at it that way
Maybe but the barren does not crit 100% of the time.

There would be a problem if the barrels did lichbane increased damage, but translated it to physical damage. It would be a milder case of the runeglaive GP. There was that one patch or two that made the auto that proc'd runglaive COMPLETELY magic damage, remiscent of Viktor q. GP would go critplank (this was pre-rework), and grab runeglaive and - his auto's would crit for ~800 physical damage, and his q's would crit for ~1000 magic damage. It was insane. Of course, it wasn't well known so not many people played it.
Triforce is physical damage. Lichbane is magic damage. It's as simple as that.
Considering that he only has one AP scaling......
he has 2, his ult and his oranges.
Cmon....that's like saying the AP scaling on Yi's meditate means you should build AP

(before the nerf) AP Yi was actually a thing. Lol but really it would just mean that you could build Rageblade on Yi (or GP) and get some benefit out of it. Makes a couple items a bit more viable but not much else.
I am well aware of the AP Yi of old...I don't discount that Rageblade isn't viable on Yi.  But that's not AP Yi.
AP scalings dont have to be offensive or translate into magic damage. Theres a reason why AP Yi, AP Tryn, and AP Xin were nerfed into the ground.

Old AP YI had an AP ratio on his Q.
It wasn't just his heal.

That's one out of three champions he named.

*What about the other two?*
ap tryn had e, ap xin was like kayle, ap and as.

was AP tryn's E or AP Xin's Attack Speed the problem? Did those skills even get hit with the nerfs? 

Or was it the defensive scalings that got crushed (to make AP Tryn and AP Xin unviable)

The heal on Trynd was what got gutted to removed AP Trynd. All it's scaling used to be on the "base" heal and not on the fury consumed like it is now so it didn't matter if you crit as old AP Trynd when you could heal for half your health bar with no Fury.
That... wasn't the point I was making.
wanted it to be clear that they weren't just a heal.

My bad, clicked reply to the wrong post.

NOW THAT YOU MENTION IT.
Xin and Trynd both have damaging spells that scale with AP, as well as AP scaling heal. Kinda like old AP Yi
But it still did physical damage and wasnt what was obnoxious about his kit to warrant a change.

No, but it was part of WHY ap yi worked.
Sure the W was annoying, but it wasn't the problem.

AP Yi got needed because of the damage on his Q and if you build just AP, he is squishy and does no damage.  Tryndamere get some damage on his slow but otherwise needs AD to scale.  Xin would be the only champion I would consider to be remotely viable from those listed at full AP because of the total nuke damage he would get.

you really have no idea what you are talking about. old ap yi was not squishy and did massive damage, trynd did damage on his spins and healed from 1 hp to 2k with his q and ap xin would have for 700+ every three hits there is a reason riot nerfed all of that
I'm not talking about old Yi or old Trynd or old Xin...I'm talking about those champions currently

You know that youre blindingly ignoring my argument, right? 

My argument was that defensive AP scalings were extremely strong on certain champions. Youre saying that youre ignoring those champions because they dont do that now, which is because they were nerfed super hard due to their defensive scalings being so strong.
you can't just ignore the past. if you do that, then you end up making worse decisions for it.
Lol I am not ignoring the past.  Whatever.  Yall are silly anyway for trying to defend that AP GP should be a thing.
i think that ap gp could be a fun but underpowered version of normal gp. which is fine, and it lets the game have an extra dynamic that it otherwise wouldn't.
No, it really isn't, GP's ult has semi-decent scaling and his W is a 1:1 ratio last i checked.
Alright you go ahead and play AP GP and I'll literally anything else and we'll see how that goes.
AP gp is legit. You can build a lich bane to get a scaling on q
Except the core premise of GP is huge crits with his Q and his barrels.  Literally the largest strength is that.  If you build AP you lose that.

if you build ap you gain a massive damage ult, great for team fights, op on a lock down team (cc heavy) you never die with your heals and your q does a shit ton thanks to lichbane, lose out on the barrels sure BUT THATS THE POINT OF THIS THREAD

There is literally no way you are playing AP GP against Summoners of equal skill to you and winning with it.  He becomes really squishy, his most influential skill (barrels) do nothing.  Sure you can get lich bane procs on your Q but that's not really that much damage.  Sure you can heal from oranges but that's a pretty long cool down.  Sure you have the ult damage but that's not only a long cool down.  The ultimate ability scaling with AP should never be the only reason to build AP on a champion.  You get to use it so infrequently that is just inefficient.  

Too each their own but I am fairly certain you will not see success with AP GP.  Maybe fun, but not success.
You've clearly never faced AP GP. It isn't as bad as you think.
I mean it won't do like any damage...sure it might not be awful but there would just be so little damage to really do anything
anything else? adc galio.
He _does_ have one of the highest starting base ad's.
That may have been a slight exaggeration, although i could find a way to make it work
nah they nerfed the oranges down to 0.9 AP when they added the %missing health heal to it
ult 1.2 ratio W 0.9 ratio i believe

Please..the removal of mana refund on Q and increasing in ult CD hit AP GP so hard. 

This is the buff we need!
I agree, either forbid spellblade increasing barrel damage or let them all... preferable the former.
dont his barrels scale off ad not ap???

Tecnhically, his barrels don't scale with anything. They apply the damage done to the first barrel, meaning if you - as so often happens - crit the first barrel with a Parrrley, the entire chain will have barrels critting for that damage.
No.... it was gimmicky and absolutely stupid to play against should he survive long enough for items.  It's a good thing for the overall health of the game that it's gone.
